articles.title: Here’s what everyone should know about this new HIV prevention shot - The Washington Post
articles.summary: Here’s what everyone should know about this new HIV prevention shot Yeztugo, a twice-a-year shot approved by the FDA, was highly effective in two randomized trials. It costs $28,218 per year, and people have to be HIV-negative to get it. Lenacapavir, made by Gilead Sciences, in its injectable form. articles.summary: 'Razor blade throat': Answers to questions about the new COVID variant File photo (Tessa Weinberg/Missouri Independent). The COVID-19 variant that may be driving a recent rise in cases in some parts of the world has earned a new nickname: “razor blade throat” COVID. That’s because the variant — NB. 1.8.1. or “Nimbus” — may cause painful sore throats. The symptom...
